newsitem.title: USA: Flagstar Bancorp up after IPO price slashed.
newsitem.headline: Flagstar Bancorp up after IPO price slashed.

text.p: Shares of Flagstar Bancorp squeaked out a slim premium on their first day of trading, although the Bloomfield Hills, Mich.-based bank had to offer shares at a sharply lower-than-expected price.
Shares were up 1/8 to 13-1/8 in late trading on Wednesday after the thrift holding company's initial public offering, with nearly 1.7 million shares traded.

The shares were priced at $13 each, well below their expected price of $19 to $21 a share, as estimated by the company and its underwriters in filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

Five million shares were sold in the offering, with 2.2 million sold by the company and the remainder by selling shareholders. Originally, 8.05 million shares were going to be offered in the IPO, with 2.2 million by the company and 5.85 by selling shareholders.
Flagstar Bancorp is profitable and is one of the largest U.S. originators of conforming single-family mortgage loans, according to the filings.
Lehman Brothers was the lead underwriter of the offering.
